commits.message: feat: Use explicit linker script for 1MB flash B/W radios (#4244)

issue.title: Boxer build error

labels.name: bug 🪲
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this problem?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### What part of EdgeTX is the focus of this bug?

Transmitter firmware

### Current Behavior

Error when assembling the firmware. Error there is not enough flash memory. Although Boxer, unlike all STM 32F407, has 1MB of flash. There is a processor in it  STM32F407VGT6 with 1MB Flash and 192KB RAM.


### Expected Behavior

Firmware build up to 1MB

### Steps To Reproduce

For example, to build a firmware with a Russian translation.

### Version

Nightly (Please give date/commit below)

### Transmitter

Radiomaster Boxer

### Operating System (OS)

Windows

### OS Version

_No response_

### Anything else?

![image](https://github.com/EdgeTX/edgetx/assets/39222879/8f39f751-e103-4b49-99dd-7d35b7356ec8)

pull_request.title: feat: use explicit linker script for 1MB flash B/W radios
pull_request.body:
Adds explicit linker script for B/W radios with 1MB flash memory (e.g. RadioMaster Boxer). This removes the 512 kB limitation on such radios.

Fixes #4240 and #4243.

issue.title: fix(tts): DE play value "TIME" wrong for 00:xx:xx hours

labels.name: sound 🔉
labels.description: Related to generated or played audio/sound

issue.body:
Fixes #4235 

Summary of changes:
- fixed use of  singular and plural in TIME tts
- removed "and" between hours and minutes (as is implemented for language EN) to make for shorter and more concise "TIME" speech messages

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,7 +181,7 @@ void menuRadioSetup(event_t event)
     CASE_IMU(LABEL(IMU))
     CASE_IMU(0)
     CASE_IMU(0)
-    LABEL(ALARMS), 0, CASE_CAPACITY(0)
comment.body: Thanks. I've removed this code plus associated code from a few other files. Also removed unused strings only used by this code.

pull_request.title: chore(radio): Cleanup startup code.
pull_request.body:
Fixes #4018 

Summary of changes:
- Remove SPLASH build option
- Move splash handling code to gui files/folders
- Rename opentxXXX functions to edgeTxXXX
- Fix throttle warning startup timing (haptic played before splash screen finished on color LCD)
- Use radio setting to control startup/shutdown haptic

issue.title: Play value "TIME" wrong after midnight

labels.name: bug 🪲
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: sound 🔉
labels.description: Related to generated or played audio/sound

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this problem?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### What part of EdgeTX is the focus of this bug?

Transmitter firmware

### Current Behavior

I defined a Global Function to Play Value "Time" when pressing switch 6P5.
Works as expected 23 hours of the day. But between midnight and 1 o clock in the morning the voice says "1 hour" instead of "zero hour".

### Expected Behavior

It would be nice, if "Play value" would interpret the zero value correctly.


_This is an issue of very low priority if it only affects "Play Time".
But it might affect "play value" of other variables with a value of ZERO._

### Steps To Reproduce

Define a global or special function to "Play value" with the variable "TIme".
Set the time in Setup to any value between 00:00:00 and 00:59:59.
Activate the special or global function. 
The hours-value playing is ONE hour instead of ZERO hour.

### Version

2.9.1

### Transmitter

Radiomaster TX16S / TX16SMK2

### Operating System (OS)

_No response_

### OS Version

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

labels.name: sound 🔉
labels.description: Related to generated or played audio/sound

issue.body:
Fixes #4235 

Summary of changes:
- fixed use of  singular and plural in TIME tts
- removed "and" between hours and minutes (as is implemented for language EN) to make for shorter and more concise "TIME" speech messages

comment.body: If as native speakers you're happy with it as it is, since it really only affects you guys, should be fine. #3920 seems to have cherrypicked cleanly into 2.9, I'll see if this co-operates also...

issue.title: fix (color)  Fix refrehing of GPS and DATE_TIME telemetry values when using Value-Widget.
issue.body:
Fixes #4170 

Summary of changes:
With data-types who are not plain 32bit numbers, like GPS, Text, DATE_TIME,  we have to populate the telemetry "value" with something that changes so that the "value" widget detects the change.  The trick is to populate the "value" with a hash of the GPS or DATE_TIME complex value. The actual value for GPS and DateTime are stored in different variables. 

The "value" widget was not displaying correctly DATE_TIME, fixed it (don't know why was moving the x coordinate -42 pixels!).
Change dateTime format to ISO 8601 date for color radios (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS).

NOTE: B&W was already this format (with 4 digits for year), and sensor log writing too... good for consistency.

NOT COMPILED FOR PRODUCTION: Updated Spektrun GPS testing code to change the values for GPS coordinates and Date without having the physical sensor (used previously captured data). 

NOTE:  Same PR worked for 2.9.1 as well as Main.

comment.body: Fantastic! :) Yes, YYYY-MM-DD makes more sense to me, as you can straight away work out the year, and hopefully then figure out it's MM-DD after that.

issue.title: feat: more flexible ADC inputs

labels.name: enhancement ✨
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
Summary of changes:
- use `FLEX` instead of `POT` ,`AXIS`, and 'MOUSE'
- add support for configuring ADC input as `SWITCH`
- support for ADC inversion in UI

@elecpower there is yet another change in YAML format (for the better likely)

This PR introduces the following YAML changes:
- `potsConfig` has additional types: `switches`, `axis_x` and `axis_y`.
- `potsConfig` now supports inversion with `inv` (`0` or `1`).
```yaml
potsConfig:
   EXT1:
      type: switch
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT2:
      type: switch
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT3:
      type: axis_x
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT4:
      type: axis_y
      inv: 0
      name: ""
```
- a new block called `flexSwitches` defines up to 2 additional on targets supporting this (only TX16 for now):
  *Please note:* `flexConfig` must be placed *after* `potsConfig`. The loader will verify that the `channel` (analog source) is indeed configured as `switch`.
```yaml
flexSwitches: 
   FL1:
      channel: EXT1
   FL2:
      channel: EXT2
```
- up to 2 new switches called `FL1` and `FL2`

comment.body: Indeed. It compiled this time, so that is next 🤭

issue.title: feat: more flexible ADC inputs

labels.name: enhancement ✨
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
Summary of changes:
- use `FLEX` instead of `POT` ,`AXIS`, and 'MOUSE'
- add support for configuring ADC input as `SWITCH`
- support for ADC inversion in UI

@elecpower there is yet another change in YAML format (for the better likely)

This PR introduces the following YAML changes:
- `potsConfig` has additional types: `switches`, `axis_x` and `axis_y`.
- `potsConfig` now supports inversion with `inv` (`0` or `1`).
```yaml
potsConfig:
   EXT1:
      type: switch
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT2:
      type: switch
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT3:
      type: axis_x
      inv: 0
      name: ""
   EXT4:
      type: axis_y
      inv: 0
      name: ""
```
- a new block called `flexSwitches` defines up to 2 additional on targets supporting this (only TX16 for now):
  *Please note:* `flexConfig` must be placed *after* `potsConfig`. The loader will verify that the `channel` (analog source) is indeed configured as `switch`.
```yaml
flexSwitches: 
   FL1:
      channel: EXT1
   FL2:
      channel: EXT2
```
- up to 2 new switches called `FL1` and `FL2`

comment.body:
> Is it now ADC_INPUT_FLEX instead of ADC_INPUT_POT?

I believe yes, but we'd better re-check to see if that works properly.

pull_request.title: chore(color): Cleanup layout refresh logic.
pull_request.body:
Summary of changes:
- Remove top bar forced refresh of widgets, let widgets decide if refresh is needed (while retaining 100ms refresh interval)
- Adjust main view layout when options are changed instead of checking options repeatedly in the checkEvents function
- Adjust date time widget to only refresh when value changes
